alert.note: Alert for Furnas; Harlan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 07 at 5:43PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of north central Kansas and south central Nebraska, including the following counties, in north central Kansas, Osborne, Phillips and Rooks. In south central Nebraska, Furnas and Harlan. * WHEN...Through early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Some area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Although rain amounts could vary considerably within the Watch area, the potential exists for at least 1 to 2 inches in a short time, with localized higher amounts possible. Those areas that received very heavy rain over the past several days will be most prone to possible flooding issues tonight. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
